main_definition: Wilson can be a surname, name of an event or product, as well as a term related to the famous American presidential candidate Theodore Roosevelt.

meanings_and_examples.example: James Wilson, one of the Founding Fathers of the United States.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Name of an event related to World War I
meanings_and_examples.example: The signing of the Treaty of Versailles on June 28, 1919, formally ending World War I. The negotiations took place in the Palace of Versailles and were led by President Woodrow Wilson.
The Wilson Quarterback Model football, known for its innovative design featuring a pointed ball.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Term related to Theodore Roosevelt and his policies
meanings_and_examples.example: Roosevelt's 'Wilsonianism' refers to the foreign policy principles of President Woodrow Wilson, which include self-determination for nations and a strong international presence led by America.
